edu.cooper

Class FlowManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cooper.FlowManager

  • public class FlowManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages the traffic simulation.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FlowManager

        public FlowManager(java.lang.String paramfile)
        Initialize FlowManager with the parameters set in the .properties file specified by paramfile
        Parameters:
        paramfile - The .properties file from which to load the paraemters.

      • FlowManager

        public FlowManager(ConfigReader conf)
        If you want programmatic access to the parameters, you can use this constructor. You can pass in a ConfigReader object and use the setX() method of the ConfigReader object to update the parameters. After you've updated the parameters, call updateParams() and you're ready to simulate.
        Parameters:
        conf -

    • Method Detail

      • updateParams

        public void updateParams()
        A useful function if you want to programmatically update the parameters. Call it before starting your simulations, so that the simulation uses the new parameters.

      • clearRoads

        public void clearRoads()
        Resets the roads in between rounds so they have no drivers on them.

      • simulate

        public double[] simulate()
        Runs one round of simulation. The simulation proceeds in 4 steps.
        1. Each agent chooses a route. Some of the agents (specified by G in the .properties file), choose a new route. The other 1-G agents use the same route as before. Some of the agents (specified by p in the .properties file), make use of the TRPF to decide which route. The other (1-p)G choose randomly. The number of agents on each route is collected.
        2. The agents are added to their chosen routes and travel to their destinations.
        3. The agents that use the TRPF report the congestion level on their route using the difference between the number of cars currently on the route and the number of cars that there should be at the System Optimum.
        4. Metrics are printed out.
        Returns:
        Returns the cost of each route.

      • getCosts

        public double[] getCosts()
        Returns the costs of each route. It finds the cost of a route by looping through the roads on that route and adding up the cost of each road.
        Returns:
        The costs of each route. The kth element contains the cost of route k.

      • getAvgCost

        public double getAvgCost(double[] costs,
                int[] routenums)
        Returns the average travel time of all agents.
        Parameters:
        costs - The costs for each route.
        routenums - The number of drivers on each route.
        Returns:
        Returns the average travel time of an agent.
